questions.question: Which of these is NOT a key feature of Python?
questions.explanation: ðŸš€ Python is an interpreted language, not compiled. The interpreter executes code line-by-line rather than compiling the entire program first. Memory management is handled through garbage collection.

questions.question: What makes Python cross-platform compatible?
questions.explanation: ðŸ’» The PVM (Python Virtual Machine) executes bytecode making Python platform-independent. The same bytecode can run on any machine with a PVM implementation.
